hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=475 Via Ortega, Stanford, CA 94305, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Hacks that are more difficult to implement will be scored highly. Impressive architecture, technical difficulty, and solving hard problems are all important parts of a successful hack. Using more advanced technologies is also a plus.
Beautifully designed, and seamless and bug-less hacks, are impressive and rare, and will be valued as such. A fully polished product, ready to ship, and without major bugs or oversights, is great.

We want TreeHacks to be an environment that encourages highly innovative and different ideas, so we will be keeping an eye out for ideas that pique our interest or make us see the space or problem differently.

hackathon-description-header: Join us as we build apps, hardware, and community in the California sun.
hackathon-location-description: Stanford University - Jen-Hsun Huang Engineering Center
